bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: King William County was formed in 1701 from King and Queen County.
Most records were destroyed by a courthouse fire on 17 January 1885. Only a few order books and deed books exist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: King William County (Va.) Circuit Court Records, 1796-1863, consist of documents related to judgments (1796, 1797, 1805, 1828, 1829); fiduciary records (1818); tax and fiscal records (1804, 1816); will of Lewis Littlepage (1863); and marriage licenses (1823, 1840.)

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals are located at the Henry E. Huntington Library, San Marino, California.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional King William County court records, marriage records, wills, tax and fiscal records, and fiduciary records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm."
See the Lost Records Localities Digital Collection available at Virginia Memory.
